duties_responsibilities.duty: Execution of regulatory strategies to support the global development of oncology and hematology portfolio.
Assess applications for completeness and conformity with relevant regulations.
Oversee the maintenance of regulatory applications (IND/CTA, NDA) to ensure compliance with applicable regulations.
Prepare and manage regulatory documents and other submissions.
Offer regulatory guidance and support to cross-functional project teams.
Perform regulatory review of submission materials to ensure timeliness, accuracy, and alignment with business goals and regulations.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure effective planning and execution of submissions.
Ensure proper archiving of correspondence and submissions.
Conduct regulatory research and intelligence to keep project teams informed about the evolving regulatory environment and potential strategic implications.
Facilitate interactions with regulatory authorities and contribute to the formulation of overall regulatory strategies.

education_certification.credential: Minimum bachelor’s degree in a science or related field.
8+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical/biotechnology industry.
Experience in oncology, orphan-drug, NDA, and commercial regulatory affairs is advantageous.
Profound understanding of the US and EU regulatory landscape.
Demonstrated ability to critically analyze scientific information with meticulous attention to detail.
Takes ownership of outcomes within and beyond the assigned responsibilities.
Capable of professional influence and negotiation at various levels within project teams and with external partners.
